page.title: 03Mining Past and Present
page.content: Fochriw was once a mining village with two pits,Fochriw Pit and South Tunnel Pit.These areas have been landscaped by the National Coal Board.A large area of land between Rhymney and Pontlottyn has been landscaped and a new road put in bypassing Rhymney. It was built on the site of a small pit,Rhymney Ironworks and Barracks Level.There is still a washery for the open cast mine at Cwm Bargoed.At the village of Pentwyn Mr Llewellyn and his employees still work a level.By the feeder pond above Fochriw there is a second level worked by Mr Rowe.The Hymac Factory in Rhymney is not being used at present because it went out of business in 1983.
